abstract: Treasury Sec Jacob J Lew's announcement that starting in 2020s new $5, $10 and $20 notes will be issued featuring women and African-Americans has raised question of how widespread use of paper money will be by that point in time; trends clearly indicate that Americans are increasingly using credit and debit cards for most transactions.

headline.print_headline: Tubman’s $20 Should Beat a Future Cashless Society
headline.main: A Cashless Society? Not Before Tubman’s $20 Arrives

snippet: Though Americans are relying less on paper money for transactions, the demise of greenbacks is expected to take a longer time than many imagine.
lead_paragraph: Though Americans are relying less on paper money for transactions, the demise of greenbacks is expected to take a longer time than many imagine.
